Sentencas: During the actual operation of the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), degradation is one of the most difficult technical problems to overcome.
Titulo: Long-Term Degradation Trend Prediction and Remaining Useful Life Estimation for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Predicting the degradation trend and estimating the remaining useful life (RUL) can effectively diagnose the potential failure and prolong the useful life of the fuel cell.
Titulo: Long-Term Degradation Trend Prediction and Remaining Useful Life Estimation for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: To study the degradation trend of the SOFC under constant load conditions, a SOFC degradation model based on the ohmic area specific resistance (ASR) is presented first in this paper.
Titulo: Long-Term Degradation Trend Prediction and Remaining Useful Life Estimation for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Based on this model, a particle filter (PF) algorithm is proposed to predict the long-term degradation trend of the SOFC.
Titulo: Long-Term Degradation Trend Prediction and Remaining Useful Life Estimation for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The prediction performance of the PF is compared with that of the Kalman filter, which shows that the proposed algorithm is equipped with better accuracy and superiority.
Titulo: Long-Term Degradation Trend Prediction and Remaining Useful Life Estimation for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the RUL of the SOFC is estimated by using the obtained degradation prediction data.
Titulo: Long-Term Degradation Trend Prediction and Remaining Useful Life Estimation for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The results show that the model-based RUL estimation method has high accuracy, while the excellence of the PF algorithm for degradation trend prediction and RUL estimation is proven.
Titulo: Long-Term Degradation Trend Prediction and Remaining Useful Life Estimation for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
